name: Shangtong Zhang
content: Shangtong Zhang | My Homepage Assistant Professor Department of Computer Science University of Virginia Office: 422 Rice Hall Mail: 85 Engineer's Way, Charlottesville, VA, 22903 Email: shangtong@virginia.edu [Google Scholar] [Twitter] [Curriculum Vitae] [Github] [PhD Thesis] [Calendar] [Zoom] [Prospective Students] [UVA RL Meetup] Biography Shangtong Zhang is an Alf Weaver Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Virginia, directing the Sequential Intelligence Lab (SIL). His research focuses on both theoretical and empirical aspects of reinforcement learning, resulting in multiple scholarly articles in major AI venues, e.g., JMLR, NeurIPS, ICML, and ICLR. He also regularly serves as Area Chair in major AI venues, e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, Senior Area Chair in RL Conference, and panelists and reviewers for major federal (e.g., NSF) and international (e.g., Austrian Science Fund FWF) funding agencies. He and his research are recognized by multiple awards and honors, including best paper awards at ICML workshop and AAMAS, NSF CAREER Award, AAAI New Faculty Highlights, Cisco Faculty Research Award, Rising Star in AI, NeurIPS Top Area Chair, and IFAAMAS Victor Lesser Dissertation Award. He obtained his DPhil at the University of Oxford, MSc at the University of Alberta, and BSc at Fudan University.
